externalId.description: Unique external ID for the account

isTestnet.description: Flag to indicate if the account is a testnet account

acceptsAllAssets.description: This parameter defines if this target is able to accept all tokens

activatedAssets.description: If tokens of a blockchain should be activated prior to any operation, this parameter includes a list of currencies to be activated with corresponding status - otherwise, the field is set as null

metadata.description: Additional metadata you want to store with a new Deposit Target

requiresAssetsActivation.description: This parameter defines if this target is able to accept all tokens

accountIds.description: Comma-separated account ids, if address set for particular accounts

assetId.description: The unique ID for this asset

assetType.description: What kind of asset this is. [See details](/enums/AssetType)

contractInformation.description: For crypto tokens, this contains the smart contract address and other technical blockchain details.

decimals.description: How many decimal places this asset can be split into

networkId.description: Which blockchain network this asset lives on (like Ethereum, Bitcoin). Only needed for crypto tokens - not used for regular money or exchange assets

symbol.description: Human-readable short name for this asset. Note: it can be changed by the issuer at any time.

symbolId.description: Points to the symbol that represents this asset (which stores symbol, name, icon etc.)

verified.description: True if we've confirmed this is the real, official token (not a fake/scam copy). Helps you avoid fraudulent tokens with similar names.

totalBalance.description: The overall balance of a account

externalBroadcast.description: Withdraw is requested to be processed by external system. In that case we don't broadcast it to blockchain

accountIds.description: Comma-separated account ids, if address set for particular accounts

networkId.description: Blockchain Network Id of an address

accountId.description: The id of the account where the intent transaction should be placed

fromAmount.description: The amount of asset that will be sent. Optional, one of `fromAmount` or `toAmount` must be specified.

intentId.description: Unique intent identifier from client (should be unique per the account)

accountId.description: The id of the account where the transaction should be placed

expiresAt.description: Optional expiration time for the transaction

externalId.description: Unique transaction identifier from client (should be unique per the account)

assetId.description: The asset ID for the transaction

networkId.description: The asset's blockchain network name for the transaction

unlimited.description: Allowance unlimited flag. If true then allowance is unlimited, amount will be ignored

allowance.description: For 'allowance' event. Specify to which address allowance was granted

in.description: For 'in' event. Specify from which address the funds are transferred

out.description: For 'out' event. Specify to which address the funds are transferred

transactionFailed.description: If transaction was added to block, but transaction execution failed (e.g. smart contract execution failed)

fromAccountId.description: Account ID where assets were sent from

fromAddressBookRecordId.description: Address Book Record ID where assets were sent from

toAccountId.description: Account ID where assets were sent to

toAddressBookRecordId.description: Address Book Record ID where assets were sent to

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp of the intent (epoch millis)

expiresAt.description: Expiration timestamp of the intent (epoch millis)

fromAmount.description: Amount of the from-asset specified by the user

fromAssetId.description: ID of the asset being sent

intentId.description: Unique user-generated ID of the intent

status.description: Current status of the intent order. [See details](/enums/IntentOrderStatus)

toAmount.description: Amount of the to-asset requested or estimated

toAssetId.description: ID of the asset to receive

updatedAt.description: Last update timestamp of the intent (epoch millis)

userSettlementDeadline.description: Deadline timestamp for user settlement (epoch millis)

userIds.description: List of user IDs for which the limit will apply

accountIds.description: Apply to withdrawals made to particular Accounts

addressBookRecordIds.description: Apply to withdrawals made to particular Address Book records

toAccounts.description: Apply to withdrawals made to Accounts

toAddressBook.description: Apply to withdrawals made to Address Book records

toExternalAddresses.description: Apply to all withdrawal to external (non Address Book) addresses

authorisedApproversUserIds.description: List of users that are allowed to approve transactions

durationHours.description: Duration of the transaction security delay in hours

accountIds.description: Apply to withdrawals made from accounts IDs

hashFunction.description: Hash function to apply to the message before signing. [See details](/enums/HashFunction)

keyType.description: Type of cryptographic key to use for signing this message. [See details](/enums/KeyType)

message.description: The message content that needs to be signed

signatureScheme.description: Cryptographic signature scheme to use for signing. [See details](/enums/SignatureScheme)

signatureVariant.description: Specific variant of the signature scheme if applicable. [See details](/enums/SignatureVariant)

messages.description: List of individual messages that need to be cryptographically signed

publicKey.description: Public key that corresponds to the private key used for signing these messages

useBackupPrimitive.description: Flag indicating whether to use backup cryptographic primitives for signing

addressExplorerUrl.description: Website URL where you can look up addresses on this network

confirmations.description: How many block confirmations are needed before a transaction is considered final and safe

explorerUrl.description: Website URL where you can look up transactions on this network

isTestnet.description: True if this is a test network used for development/testing (not real money)

name.description: The human-readable name of this network that users will see

networkId.description: The unique ID for this blockchain network

message.description: Signing message

blockchainNonce.description: Blockchain nonce number for transaction ordering if applicable

messagesForSigning.description: Messages that need to be signed for this request

networkId.description: Network identifier specifying which blockchain network to use

requestParameters.description: Initial request parameters required for blockchain services (flexible JSON structure)

shouldBeBroadcasted.description: Flag indicating whether the transaction should be broadcasted after signing

signed.description: Final signed transaction data ready for broadcasting

signingData.description: Blockchain transaction data that needs to be signed

signingRequestId.description: Unique identifier for this signing request

status.description: Current status of the signing request. [See details](/enums/SigningRequestStatus)

transactionId.description: Unique identifier of the transaction to be signed

transactionType.description: Type of transaction being signed. [See details](/enums/TransactionType)

name.description: The full name of what this symbol represents

symbol.description: The ticker symbol that traders and users recognize

symbolId.description: The unique ID for this symbol

baseSymbolId.description: The symbol you're getting the price for

price.description: The actual market price - how much one unit of the base symbol costs in the quote symbol. For example, if Bitcoin costs $145,000 USD, this would be 145000

quoteSymbolId.description: The currency the price is shown in

accountType.description: The type of the account where the transaction should be placed. [See details](/enums/AccountType)

embedded.description: Embedded related objects for this transaction

externalId.description: Unique transaction identifier from client (should be unique per account)

approvedBy.description: User IDs who already approved this transaction

availableApprovers.description: Users IDs who can approve this transaction

limitId.description: ID of the transaction limit applied

number.description: Number of users required to approve this transaction

securityDelayDuration.description: Security delay duration in hours before transaction can be processed

securityDelayExpiresAt.description: Security delay expiration time in milliseconds

skipApproval.description: Skip approval process if set in the limit rule

blockchainDetails.description: The blockchain transaction details on an transaction

confirmations.description: Number of confirmations for a blockchain transaction

depositTransactionId.description: The ID of a deposit transaction where a withdraw was made to

fromAccountId.description: The ID of a account where an order was made from

fromAddress.description: The address where the funds were received

toAccountId.description: The ID of a account where an transaction was made to

toAddress.description: The address where the funds should be transferred

withdrawTransactionId.description: The ID of a withdraw transaction where a deposit was made from

lastSignInAt.description: Last sign in at timestamp in milliseconds

assetId.description: The asset ID for the transaction

feeLevel.description: The fee level for the withdrawal. [See details](/enums/FeeLevel)

includeFee.description: Indicates whether the fee should be included in the withdrawal amount or added on top of it

networkId.description: The asset's blockchain network name for the transaction

symbol.description: The asset's symbol for the transaction

toAccountId.description: In case of a transfer on a different account, the ID of the destination account

toAddressBookRecordId.description: In case of a withdrawal to address from address book, the ID of the address book record

updatedAt.description: Last updated at timestamp in milliseconds

permissionGroups.description: List of permission groups the member belongs to

info.description: Bron API is based on the RESTish interface provided for data exchange between a client and a server with the use of HTTPS requests and responses.

post.description:
Universal Create Transaction endpoint for moving on-chain assets with full control over parameters. Use it to:

* Transfer base currencies (BTC, ETH, etc.) or any supported token between your own accounts.

* Send funds to any external blockchain address  directly or via a saved address-book record.

* Fine-tune fees and network settings.

<sup>API Key permissions: Manage Transfers</sup>

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error
A human-readable message providing more details about the error
A human-readable message providing more details about the error

post.description:
Bulk transactions creation. If the execution of an transaction fails, it will not affect the execution of other transactions. Failed transactions will be returned in the response. The bulk size should be less than 50 transactions.
